title: (x) Serif face w/ nice ligatures - Mrs. Eaves {Jelmar Geertsma}
content:
Hi all,

Not at my machine to test, is this MrsEaves?

[http://www.tonigreaves.com/introduction/index.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202184110/http:/www.tonigreaves.com/introduction/index.htm "http://www.tonigreaves.com/introduction/index.htm")

Thanks

 [‹ (x) Mysterious sans serifs - AVenir, Gotham {Stephen}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202184110/http:/www.typophile.com/node/36318 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Thank You For Your Purchase" basic grotesque in Adobe Order Confirmation - Vonness {Stephen} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202184110/http:/www.typophile.com/node/32729 "Go to next forum topic")
author: reboot

comments.content:
I didn’t think Mrs. Eaves had a “gi” or “it” ligature.

Could it be Feijoa  
 [http://www.klim.co.nz/feijoa\_samples.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202184110/http:/www.klim.co.nz/feijoa_samples.php "http://www.klim.co.nz/feijoa\_samples.php")

Not Feijoa (x-height too tall).  
Mrs. Eaves has at least it-ligature.  
 [http://emigre.com/EF.php?fid=142](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202184110/http:/emigre.com/EF.php?fid=142 "http://emigre.com/EF.php?fid=142")

It is Mrs. Eaves.
The [gi-lig](http://web.archive.org/web/20081202184110/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/emigre/mrs-eaves/just-lig-roman/mac-t1/230489/character/0067/CP4/1/)is at the l/c g at the Justligatures weight
